  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
As an admin I would like specify which users can edit the original time estimate.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a project permission to allow only certain users permission to edit this field.

h3. Workaround 
Set up workflow conditions to stop this from being edited.  Please see the following documentation for further details: https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=149834

There is also a third-party plugin, [Field Security Plugin for JIRA|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.quisapps.jira.jfs/server/overview] which does something similar.
fields.summary: As an admin I would like to set permission for users editing the original time estimate

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61736].
  {panel}

Suggested:
The Workflow Designer in Jira 6 and 7 could benefit greatly from a toggle-able grid. Recomended spacing would be equal to half the height of a status label. This would then work with the existing snapping to the top, bottom, and center of other status labels.

Issue:
Currently, the centers or sides of statuses will snap to the center or sides other existing statuses (and display the relevant guide) for the sake of lining them up in straight lines. However there's nothing to help with spacing. This, together with the fact that you can't move the transition lines or labels (JRA-35712) adds a lot of time to the Workflow design process in order to make a complex workflow neat and clear.

To Reproduce the issue:
To reproduce the issue and demonstrate the need for a grid, grab any status label in the workflow designer and move it in any direction AWAY from other status labels. There are no guides to help ensure that spacing is clear or equidistant from other status labels, only guides that show whether a status label is in line with other status labels.
fields.summary: Give the Workflow Designer a toggle-able Grid.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Performing a parallel move of a JIRA issue in two tabs will lead to undesired result

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Try moving two issues in parallel. The order:
# Open two issues in two web pages: AD-3 and AD-4
# Select Move for AD-3, choose the target project
#Go to another page, select Move for AD-4, choose the target project
# On the AD-3 page, press "Move". The issue is moved.
# Go back to the AD-4 page, press "Move". An error is shown "Cannot move Issue AD-4 because it has already been moved to AD-3.". This error, and this message, make absolutely no sense.
 !Selection_096.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
* Issue to be moved accordingly

h3.Workaround
Perform the move one-by-one
fields.summary: Parallel Move of issue resulted to odd behavior in the functionality

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently in JIRA issue linking with issues from another JIRA instance (from Application link) can only be done from the existing issue (Issue page -> More -> Link Issue).

During issue creation it's possible to add issue linking as well but it's restricted to the issues in the same JIRA instance where the issue is being created.

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow JIRA to link issue from other JIRA instance during issue creation (using Application link).

h3. Workaround 

If user would like to link issue, they have to create the issue first and then link it to another issue from the issue page.
fields.summary: JIRA Link Issue from other instance during issue creation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61726].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
As an *admin* the user could *import issue links* by going to *External System Import*, then configuring the issue links in the "Map Fields" screen of the Issue Import Wizard, under Links & Sub-Tasks, as shown in the image below:
 !issuelinkbiggest.png|thumbnail! 

But as a *non-admin*, the user is *unable* to access the *administration* panel. Consequently, the non-admin user will be unable to import issue links. In order for non-admin users to import issues from CSV, the user must go to
*issues* > *Import issues from CSV*, as shown in the image below:
 !importissuesfromcsv.png|thumbnail! 

However, if the CSV file contains issue links, the user will not be able to configure this in the "Map Fields" screen of the Issue Import Wizard, under *Links & Sub-Tasks* as it only contains Issue Id and Parent Id, as shown in the image below:
 !issuelinknotavailablebig.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Mentioned in the following KB:
[How to Import Issue Links from a CSV File as a non-admin user|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+Import+Issue+Links+from+a+CSV+File+as+a+non-admin+user]


h3. Suggested Solution
Provide the *non-admin* user with the ability to link issues through the "Map Fields" screen of the *Issue Import Wizard*.
fields.summary: Ability to Import Issue Links from a CSV File as a non-admin user

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61717].
  {panel}

*Summary*

An incorrect week number is shown in JIRA's date picker control. The problem occurs because Jira marked the same week as last week of year Y and first week of year Y+1. 

*Steps to reproduce*
# Open the date picker and go to the last week in the year, for example last week in 2020. 
# Note which week is last. 
# Move to the next week, which is the first week of the following year, for example first week in 2021. 

*Expected Result*
Week 1 2021 should not be the same as week 53 2020. Week 1 2021 should start on Sun Jan 3 and finish on Sat Jan 9. 

*Actual Result*
Week 1 2021 *is* the same as week 53 2020, which is the week starting on Sun Dec 27 and finishing on Sat Jan 2. 
 !wk53-2020.png|thumbnail!  !wk1-2021.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: An incorrect week number is shown in the date picker control

fields.description:
h3. Description
When user send a email to JIRA, a issue is created in JIRA but the reporter of the issue is referring to different user. The reason of this is because the same email address is being used by multiple users.

*Scenario*
User with Username (a2) and email (jiramailtesting@gmail.com) sends an email to JIRA. A issue is created but the reporter is refer to user with username (a1) and email (testing@gmail.com)
!image-2016-06-29-18-44-57-825.png|thumbnail! 
!image-2016-06-29-18-44-24-282.png|thumbnail!
!image-2016-06-29-18-45-16-641.png|thumbnail! 
!image-2016-06-29-18-43-34-780.png|thumbnail! 
!image-2016-06-29-18-43-55-496.png|thumbnail! 


 

h3. Step to Reproduce
# Create a user with username (a1) and email address (jiramailtesting@gmail.com) in Internal Directory
# Create a user with username (a1) and email address (testing@gmail.com) in External Directory
# Create a user with username (a2) and email address (jiramailtesting@gmail.com) in External Directory
# Put External directory as the top
# Configure Mail handler to create issue when receive email
# Send an email using the a@gmail.com
# The issue reporter will be referring to user with username (a1) and email address (testing@gmail.com)

h3. Workaround
- Edit the email address for user username (a1) in internal directory to be the same with the external directory.
fields.summary: Mail Handler create issue with wrong reporter when user email is exist in multiple directory with different username.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61714].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Since JIRA 7 it's no longer possible to have custom CSS/JS for a custom field within a JIRA "Filter Results" gadget that is used in confluence.

* jira-gadgets-plugin-6.4.2/gadgets/filter-results-gadget.xml
{code}
<![CDATA[
        #requireContext("com.atlassian.jira.gadgets:autocomplete")
        #requireContext("jira.webresources:issue-table")
        #requireResource("com.atlassian.jira.gadgets:g-filter-results")
        #includeResources()

        <script type="text/javascript">
{code}

* jira-gadgets-plugin-7.0.5/gadgets/filter-results-gadget.xml
{code}
<![CDATA[
        #requireResource("com.atlassian.jira.gadgets:autocomplete")
        #requireResource("jira.webresources:issue-table")
        #requireResource("com.atlassian.jira.gadgets:g-filter-results")
        #includeResources()

        <script type="text/javascript">
{code}

According to https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/JIRASERVER/repos/jira/commits/2ec9538e19dda08a44ac82dd20c7c05e4da363e2#jira-components/jira-plugins/jira-gadgets-plugin/src/main/resources/gadgets/filter-results-gadget.xml, the reason the change was implemented was because the gadget requires web-resources correctly from opensocial and none of it were contexts but resources and it shouldn't have worked.

However since the gadget is no longer using any contexts, it's no longer possible to inject Resources into this gadget

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement an existing or new context
fields.summary: Re-implement or add the context back into the filter-results-gadget's source code.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61710].
  {panel}

Using IE11, from the "Manage Filters" or "Manage Dashboards" screen, when I click the "Edit" link to share my filter or dashboard, the dialog that comes up does not show existing "Shared with" groups or projects.
If we add on new "Shared With" groups or project from this dialog, the existing settings get overwritten.

*Steps to reproduce:*
# Create a filter or dashboard.
# Click on "Edit" from  "Manage Filters" or "Manage Dashboards"  screen to share with a group or project.
# After update, verify that share group or project appears in the "Shared With" column for the filter or dashboard.
# Click on the "Edit" link again for the same filter or dashboard. The edit dialog does not show the existing "Shared with" groups or project.

Tested that problem exists on IE11, but works fine on Chrome 42.

*Workaround for IE11:*
Right-click on "Edit" link, and choose open in new tab or window. The existing "Shared With" groups or projects will show then.
fields.summary: Manage Filters/Dashboards "Edit" option does not show existing "Shared With" on IE

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61706].
  {panel}

When navigating sub-tasks and their parents using the links in the tickets, the browser history is no longer recording each page visit and the back button does not work as expected.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

# View an issue with sub-tasks
# Right click a sub-task and open the link in a new tab
# In the new tab, click the link to the parent ticket
# Verify the parent ticket is displayed

*Expected Results:*
Clicking the back button takes me to the sub-task I just opened in the new tab.

*Actual Results:*
The back button is disabled b/c the browser doesn't know a different URL has been visited.

*NOTES:*

* This occurs in both FireFox and Chrome.
* This occurs even if you don't open a link in a new tab, it's just the simplest way to reproduce the issue.
* This started occurring last week
* I haven't validated other links not working correctly, but I've noticed the issue quite a lot.

*Workaround*
In the meantime, users can open links/subtasks/pages in a new tab.
fields.summary: Navigating back to a subtask from a parent issue is not possible via browser history

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61704].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Slow execution of _Project_ - _Fields_ are caused by large number configuration items (custom-fields) present in the view. JIRA inefficiently computes number of related screens and doesn't cache some custom-fields data to optimize the performance.

h3. Environment
 Large JIRA instance 
* with many custom-fields (1000+)
* with many fieldlayouts items:
{code:java}
SQL> select count(1) from fieldlayout; 
556 

SQL> select count(1) from fieldlayoutitem; 
1355666

SQL> select count(1) from fieldlayoutscheme;  
477
{code}
* with many screens
{code:borderStyle=solid}
select count(1) from fieldscreen;
  1322

select count(1) from fieldscreentab;
  1803
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create large JIRA instance 
 # Open Project configuration screen
 # Go to Fields _Scheme_ (<JIRA>/plugins/servlet/project-config/<PRG>/fields)

h3. Expected Results
Initial load time is low (< 30 seconds) time and second execution is fast (< 10 seconds).

h3. Actual Results
Call takes 80-90 seconds, second call still slow.

h3. Notes
From SQL log you can see a lot of calls to DB. Total number of executed SQLs *11850*:
{code:java}
// Break down by table
awk -F'(FROM|WHERE)' '/SELECT/{print $2}' http-bio-8443-exec-11_sql | sort | uniq -c | sort -k1,1 -n

 363  fieldlayoutschemeentity
 393  fieldlayout
 393  fieldlayoutitem
 504  nodeassociation
 853  fieldlayoutscheme
1121  fieldscreen
1121  fieldscreentab
1318  propertyentry
1541  fieldscreenlayoutitem
4240  managedconfigurationitem
{code}

Second call still does a lot of SQL call to {{managedconfigurationitem}} table, this data is not cashed:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
grep 'http-bio-8080-exec-8' atlassian-jira-sql.log.3 | awk -F'(FROM|WHERE)' '/SELECT/{print $2}' | sort | uniq -c | sort -k1,1 -n
   1  public.fieldlayoutscheme ORDER BY NAME ASC"
   1  public.userhistoryitem
   2  public.propertyentry
   5  public.kpluginscfg
4466  public.managedconfigurationitem
{code}

h5. Profile data
 !JRA_61704_jps_stack.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
This is performance problem in JIRA. You can lower the impact by reducing the number of items (custom-fields) for _Field Configuration_ for project, to do that, please _Hide_ the field.
fields.summary: Slow loading of Project - Fields screen

Disclosure: I am wanting to re-bring up the "Favourite Projects" idea as mentioned here: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-28037.

As with the other ticket, it would bee extremely handy to have a set of favourite projects/filters and have them listed in the Projects and Issues dropdown in the navbar.

We have a large number of projects, but may spend 80-90% of our time in 2-3 projects. The recent works well for this purpose, except if halfway through the day we need to jump to a project we don't normally go to. It then pushes 1 or more desired projects off the recent list then we have to go through the process of listing and selecting the projects all over again.

Same goes with filters although it's not as prevalent because of dashboards.

It would be very helpful! 

Thanks!
fields.summary: Favourite Projects/Filters

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61696].
  {panel}

In jira cloud, Issue links currently take too much visual space and have bright colors which make them the only thing we can see.
For instance in the attached image, the link is useful as a straight url, but showing bright colors plus resolved status is actually harmful.
I just never care for the status. Having the link barred would be much terser and not attract the reader's attention on useless details.
In addition, the status being shown, "complete", is not the status of the issue, which is "closed". So it's an unfamiliar term that shows and only confuses the reader.

Suggestion:
1/ Get back to a strikethrough, remove the icon, and keep an underlined/url link aspect.
2/ Alternately, use softer colors, remove the icon, and be consistent and show the status 'in may case "closed") instead of "complete"/"open"/... which is not something users can relate to as it's not the status they manipulate.
fields.summary: Issue links should not take as much space in comments/description

h3. Problem Definition
When exporting issues in Firefox, the format between exporting a single issue and exporting from the search screen makes the content appear differently.

Exporting from the search for issues screen:
 !Screen Shot 2016-06-27 at 14.27.09.png|thumbnail! 

Exporting an individual issue:
 !Screen Shot 2016-06-27 at 14.27.34.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Handle individual exports in the same way as mass exports, so that the full xml file can be viewed.
fields.summary: Firefox issue view xml export is displayed as an RSS feed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61687].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently users need both the "Move Issue" and "Create Issue" permissions in order to move an issue to a different Issue Type in the same project, which doesn't seem to be very intuitive as he's not creating a new issue in the project but simply changing the Issue Type.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be better if the "Create Issue" permission was only needed when moving issues to a different project and only require the "Move Issue" permission when moving to a different Issue Type in the same project
fields.summary: Unable to change Issue Type without Create Issue permission

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61686].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition  
Creating multiple projects with unique schemes causes performance issues. The recommendation is to reduce the number of schemes by consolidating them. 

h3. Suggested Solution  
Create a tool/script (or part of JIRA's functionality) to compare the various schemes and identify duplicates.

h3. Workaround
_none_
fields.summary: As an JIRA Administrator I want to able identify duplicate schemes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61685].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently the Lucene index is the same for whole JIRA index and for large JIRA instances it can be quite large. Each time reindex is running it reindexes _archived_ projects which are not modified. Also to run search Lucene need to access whole index.

h3. Suggested Solution
# Mark project as archived (see: [JRA-61683|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-61683])
# During next reindex project will be included in the _archived_ shard and excluded from _active_ shard. 
#  Sharding the indexes by "active" vs. "archived"

h3. Notes 
See topic for more details: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/10416064/what-is-the-difference-between-a-system-level-and-project-level-reindex 

h3. Workaround 
None
fields.summary: Sharding the indexes by active vs archived

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61684].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Currently users are not able to paste attachments or screenshots when creating issue in a new tab.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud (v1000.98.4) 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access any JIRA instance (making sure that user has permission to create issues and create attachments).
# Right-click the *Create* issue button on the top blue bar to open in a new tab.
# Choose project & issue type. Click next.
# Paste (Ctrl + V) any attachment or screenshot from clipboard.

h3. Expected Results
Attachments or screenshot to be attached to the issue.

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens.

h3.Workaround
Either of the following:
* Create issue on the same tab rather than creating a new one.
* Save the attachments or screenshots in local machine. Then drag and drop or browse for the file.
fields.summary: Unable to paste attachment or screenshot when creating issue in a new tab

h3. Problem Definition
Currently there is no simple way to Online archive the project. 

h3. Suggested Solution
As an JIRA Administrator I want to mark project as _Archived_ 

h3. Workaround 
Use steps from [Archiving a project|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/archiving-a-project-802592917.html#Archivingaproject-Makingaproject'Read-Only']
fields.summary: As an JIRA Administrator I want to mark project as Archived

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61682].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently the Lucene index is the same for whole JIRA index and for large JIRA instances it can be quite large also. Eg: around 20Gb. To run search Lucene need to access whole index. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Sharding the indexes by project, which would give the ability to do things like reindex just that one project without issues from other projects being involved in the segment merge activity. Similarly, searches that are limited to a single project would have a much smaller index to work with more naturally this way.

h3. Notest
See topic for more details:  [https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/10416064/what-is-the-difference-between-a-system-level-and-project-level-reindex]
fields.summary: Sharding the indexes by project

Cheers,

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61680].
  {panel}

h4. PROBLEM:

{quote}
If an email message contains an issue key in its subject line and that issue key exists in your JIRA installation, the handler will add the email message content as a comment on the issue, regardless of which project the issue is in.
{quote}

The above quoted information doesn't seem to be working as expected. When adding a comment to an issue key from other project within JIRA, it doesn't seem to add a comment despite specifying the issue key on the subject line but rather creating a new issue on the project defined in the mail handler configuration with the issue key as the issue summary. 

h4. STEPS to REPRODUCE

# Create a mail handler and select "Create a new issue from each email message"
# Send an email to the mailbox with an existing issue key (from a different project) within JIRA and a random email body

h4. EXPECTED RESULT
- From this [page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/creating-issues-and-comments-from-email-802592933.html], it is supposed to add a comment to an existing issue key within JIRA regardless of which project the issue is in.

h4. ACTUAL RESULT
- It created a new issue on the project defined in the mail handler configuration. Having the issue key as the summary. 


h4. ENVIRONMENT
- JIRA 6.4.12 and JIRA 7.1.8
fields.summary: "Create a new issue from each email message" mail handler is not adding a comment to an existing issue

  {panel}

*Issue Summary*

When an LDAP admin removes a user from groups associated with JIRA in LDAP and synchronizes the directories again, JIRA does not update the user's group making the user still active in the instance.

*Expected Result*
User is removed from all groups and should not be able to sign in anymore having lost his groups.

*Actual Result*
User can still login as he is still active in JIRA

*Feature Suggestion*
Make a user that has lost all jira user groups inactive within JIRA or allow disable active users feature work both ways for connector directory once the directory synchronizes.
fields.summary: User Active in JIRA though all JIRA groups have been removed in LDAP

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61665].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When users try to set up a release version, they can't only choose some months. When the month has been shortened using a dot at the end, it doesn't work. In other parts of the product, like for example Due date on JIRA software this problem doesn't exist.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Log into an instance and change default language to French.
# Change your profile to French.
# Navigate to *Cog icon > Projects > choose project > Versions*.
# Try adding a date. If the month has been abbreviated using a dot (.) at the end, the system will return the error  "Please enter the date in the following format: d/MMM/yy"
 
h3. Expected Results
You can select any date.

h3. Actual Results
If the month has been abbreviated using a dot (.) at the end, the system will return the error  "Please enter the date in the following format: d/MMM/yy"
 
h3. Notes
The abbreviations are currently displayed as follows:
"janv.",
"févr.",
"mars",
"avr.",
"mai",
"juin",
"juil.",
"août",
"sept.",
"oct.",
"nov.",
"déc."

h3.Workaround
Change the profile language to English, you'll be able to enter any date (will be displayed in English).
fields.summary: Date picker doesn't work correctly in French

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61664].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
As a JIRA Administrator I want to enable "Remember my login on this computer" by default when users authenticate through the login form.

This is an existing feature when users authenticate through SSO with the [SSO for Atlassian Server and Data Center App|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1216096/sso-for-atlassian-server-and-data-center?tab=overview&hosting=datacenter].

h3. Suggested Solution
Have a setting which set "Remember my login on this computer" during users login. 

h3. Workaround
*Versions lower than Jira 8*
Modify {{atlassian-jira/includes/loginform.jsp}} and set to:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
<input class="checkbox" id="login-form-remember-me" name="os_cookie" type="checkbox" value="true" checked="true" />
{code}
\\
\\
*Running Jira 8 or higher*
_Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior on this version. A workaround will be added here when available._
fields.summary: As a JIRA Administrator I want to enable "Remember my login on this computer" by default

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61658].
  {panel}

h3. Description
In the 6.4 JIRA version, dwg file was uploaded as attachment and will automatically download when user clicks on it. 

While In JIRA 7.1.7 version, the dwg file type was treated as image file and allows you to preview it. When users click the dwg attachment in JIRA issue, it will prompt error message stating fail to load. Users will need to right clicks on the attachment and open in a new tab to download the file.

h3. Expected Bahavior
In JIRA 6.4.9, the dwg file should be automatically downloaded when user click it.

In JIRA 7.1.7, the dwg file was expected to automatically download when user click it or successfully preview the file when user click it.

h3. Actual Result
In JIRA 6.4
 !image-2016-06-24-15-36-57-721.png|thumbnail! 

In JIRA 7.1.2
 !image-2016-06-24-15-26-40-425.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Step to reproduce
# Create a ticket in JIRA 7.1.7 version
# Upload a dwg file type attachement
# Click on the attachement
# JIRA will show error message file fail to load.

h3. Workaround
Users will need to right clicks on the attachment and open in a new tab to download the file.
fields.summary: Inconsistent behavior in opening dwg file in JIRA 6.4 and JIRA 7.1.2

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA's Incoming mail handler will create comments for issues in projects that do not have mail handlers set up if the issue key is in the email subject.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 2 test projects (TEST and DEMO)
# Set up a Create a new issue or add a comment to an existing issue
 mail handler for the DEMO project only.
# No mail handler is created for the TEST project.
# Create one issue in TEST Project to get an issue with the issue key TEST-1.
# Compose a new email to send to the DEMO project's mail handler with the subject "<any test context> TEST-1".

h3. Expected Results
A new issue in the DEMO project will be created with the subject "<any test context> TEST-1".

h3. Actual Results
No new issues is created in the DEMO project and a new empty comment is created in the issue TEST-1.
fields.summary: Incoming Mail creates comments for issues without project mail handlers

h3. Summary
After upgrading JIRA from 6.2.7 to 6.4.12, the layout of the workflows that was created in JIRA 6.2.7 is being modified. Please refer to Actual Result below for better understanding.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install a vanilla instance JIRA 6.2.7.
# Create a new Simple Issue Tracking project. This will create a new workflow. Notice that the workflow will be nicely designed.
# Upgrade JIRA 6.2.7 to JIRA 6.4.12.
# View the workflow that is associated with the new Simple Issue Tracking project that was created on JIRA 6.2.7.

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When creating a sub-task, the change is not reflected in the parent issue's "updated date" nor is displayed in the parent issue's activity tab. This can pose a problem to auditing teams who need to report on the issue changes.

h3. Suggested Solution
JIRA should either update the parent issue's modified date when the sub-task is created or add an activity to the activity tab to show that a sub-task has been added/removed.
fields.summary: Creating a sub-task should update the parent issue's "Updated date" or add an entry to the activity tab in viewing issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61653].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

The [Adding the Two-Dimensional Filter Statistics Gadget|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira062/adding-the-two-dimensional-filter-statistics-gadget-588581647.html] this does a great job on configuration. However its missing a very critical piece of information.

Currently we only specify this as far as field behavior regarding the gadget:
- If choosing a custom field, please note that the following types of custom fields are supported by this gadget out-of-the-box: 'Group picker', 'Multi select', 'User picker', 'Select list' and 'Version picker'.
- What fields should/are selectable for the gadget and what the logic is in what is selectable.

From what I tell it applies all fields that is supports on the instance regardless of wether its relevant to the filter. The field itself needs to be "statable" that is to say fields the fields must be "fixed length lists" for system fields. However there a number feature request that should be documented in the documentation link such as: 

- [JRA-35903|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-35903] *Two dimensional filter gadget should include estimate fields*
- [JRA-37964|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-37964] - *Add the custom field type "Text Field" for the Two Dimensional Filter Statistics gadget*
- [JRA-41573|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-41573] *'Raised in Versions' field selection to 'Affects Version/s' in Two Dimensional Filter*
- [JRA-36720|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-36720] *Two Dimensional Filter Statistics gadget should allow sorting of values as configured in select list custom field*
- [JSW-10424|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSW-10424] *Allow gadgets to show statistics using story points instead of issue counts*
- [JRA-40193|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-40193] *Add the custom field type "Date Field" for the two dimensional filter statistics gadget*


h3. Suggested Solution
 Document more detail on what fields are selectable and provide more detail on limitations based on statistical data or current feature request.
fields.summary: More thorough documentation on functionality: "Adding the Two-Dimensional Filter Statistics Gadget"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61642].
  {panel}

When navigating amongst related links in a JIRA issue, the web browser's page history is screwed up, interfering with the user's ability to navigate.

STR:

1. visit a web site (e.g., http://www.atlassian.com).
2. visit a JIRA issue with related issues by loading a bookmark or typing in its URL (e.g., https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREE-1579).
3. click on a linked issue in the latter page (e.g., “is related to: SRCTREE-3286” link in the preceding example).
4. click the browser's Back button.

Expected: browser is returned to the previous page (SRCTREE-1579 in this example).

Actual: browser skips over the referring page (loads www.atlassian.com in this example).

Reproduced with Safari 9.1.1 (11601.6.17) and Firefox 47.0 in hosted version of JIRA 1000.98.4. (The “affects versions” field does not offer this version, so I indicated 1000.98.3 instead.)
fields.summary: Navigating to another issue breaks the browser history stack

  {panel}

At least once a month, as a JIRA system admin, I get an email bounced back to me from the account used to send the notifications from JIRA because some project level admin clicked the email address link listed at the top of the notification scheme page thinking that's what they were supposed to do to get help changing their notification scheme.

I can see why they do that. And it's annoying because unless i'm looking at every bounceback message from that account (we don't have it turned on to create issues from emails) I will miss some.

I'd love for it to say something like "Notification emails currently being sent from:" instead of just "Email:".

 !image-2016-06-23-13-24-49-185.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Modify Notification Scheme header for clarity

The JIRA documentation for [Generating a thread dump|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer071/Generating+a+thread+dump] is missing several important details that are noted on the Confluence doc [Generating a Thread Dump Externally|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Generating+a+Thread+Dump+Externally].

Missing pieces in JIRA doc:
- The note to 'Take Multiple Thread Dumps' at top looks nice and is not easily missed as in the JIRA version where its hidden further down the page
- We should include the reference to 'Generating a thread dump using our scripts' as this is a huge help to Support when troubleshooting issues that require thread dumps
-- We should include the same titled 'Output' in the JIRA doc as well as that is a nice workaround for generating a series of thread dumps without having to install the scripts

h3. Summary
When viewing JIRA issues in a mobile version of Google Chrome on Android, the value of the Select List (single choice) display as _None_ though it has a value specified. It seems to affect only this type of custom field so far.

h3. Environment
* Android 6.0.1
* JIRA Cloud v1000.98.4
* Google Chrome 51.0.2704.81

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a Select List (single choice) custom field into the JIRA issue view screen and specify a value to the issue (let's say Urgency and the value is High)
#* !Screenshot_20160622-222231.png|thumbnail!
# Open Google Chrome and view this issue in a mobile version 
# the value of the Urgency field will appear as _None_:
#* !Screenshot_20160622-222204.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

The custom field value should be displayed correctly.

h3. Actual Results

The custom field value is displaying as _None_

Change to Desktop view and the value will be displayed correctly.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61621].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
JIRA relies on Microsoft SQL Server to have the configuration 'READ_COMMITTED_SNAPSHOT'. This trips up many customers as it's not an out-of-the-box configuration for a SQL Server. This is currently documented in the [Connecting to SQL Server Config Guides|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/connecting-jira-applications-to-sql-server-2014-808761244.html]

Without this value, there are parts of JIRA that deadlock, which results in a poor experience for our customers. With the deadlock, the JIRA instance hangs/crashes, typically with a high number of active database connections.  

h3. Environment
JIRA + Microsoft SQL Server

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Various bugs and Documentation request on this such as: 
- [JRA-60928|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-60928]
- [JRA-27019|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-27019] 
- [JRA-23622|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-23622]


And KB: [Deadlocks During Operation with MS-SQL|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/deadlocks-during-operation-with-ms-sql-264045011.html]


h3. Expected Results
- JIRA Should warn the customer of this requirement at some point in the event it is not correctly configured and is a requirement. Making this misconfiguration more obvious will prevent customers from running into a common scenario.
- JIRA could avoid using database transactions in such a way which lead to the requirement to have shared locks on database objects. 


h3. Actual Results
Customers that use Microsoft SQL Server are currently required to enable this configuration due to behaviours in JIRA that result in 'competitive' queries in the database. 

The recommendation to include this in our documentation came from: [JRA-33439|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-33439]

Given that other databases have some form of transaction isolation on by default, it's perhaps likely that we want to stick with the current requirement to enable it. For example, Oracle's transaction isolation is read committed data only. 

h3. Workaround
Follow the documentation to set this value as part of setting up the JIRA Database.
fields.summary: Develop approach to handle READ_COMMITTED_SNAPSHOT requirement within JIRA

h3. Problem Definition
We need to import and export users and groups from an instance of JIRA to another. 
Currently we can do this by using restore system option but restore system option is not feasible because it will erase all the existing content in the JIRA destination.

h3. Suggested Solution
A feature that allows export and imports users in JIRA so that we can export users and group from instance A and import it in instance B

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61613].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition:
Currently, we do have a warning in regards running JIRA through port below 1024 in the documentation [Changing JIRA application TCP Ports|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer071/Changing+JIRA+application+TCP+ports] as a Non-Root user. But, any other documentation such as configuring SSL or Apache integration does not have such reminder. This could make the user using the reserved port and run JIRA as a Non-Root user in which it will be rejected.

h3. Suggested Solution:
It would be great if the reminder is included in other documentation as well that relates to the Port or System User changes. E.g.:
- [Running JIRA through SSL|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/running-jira-applications-over-ssl-or-https-802593051.html]
- [Proxying Atlassian Products using Apache|https://confluence.atlassian.com/kb/proxying-atlassian-server-applications-with-apache-http-server-806032611.html]
fields.summary: Reminder about Linux reserved port (<1024)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61612].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Attach a .eml file to a JIRA issue
# Using IE11, click the attachment link

h3. Expected results
IE11 downloads the .eml file as an attachment.

h3. Actual results
IE11 attempts to display the file inside the browser instead of downloading it.

h3. Notes
The HTTP headers when clicking the link include {{Content-Disposition:inline}}. Chrome ignores this and downloads the file correctly, but IE11 respects the header. Ideally _all_ .eml files should download as files. HTML files are actually sent with {{Content-Disposition:attachment}} even though a browser _could_ display the content inline.
fields.summary: Use Content-Disposition: attachment for .eml files
IssueService create needs sendMail parameter

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61608].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
If you update the issue type scheme while removing an issue type you can get into a state where there is an option in the optionset that doesn't exist. This database corruption was the cause of JRA-45161. Fixing this would be removing another way to get into this state. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Get an instance with an Issue Type Scheme with a set of Issue Types
# Current Option Set: [1, 2, 3], In the UI I change it to [1, 4, 2, 3]. Where these numbers represent Issue Types.
# During this processing, delete one of the Issue Types
# Check the database table optionconfiguration and there could be a possible row with an optionid that no longer exists.
# Until JRA-45161 is fixed this results in NPE in the UI. 

h3. Expected Results
Can create Issues like usual and the database table optionconfiguration should only have valid options.
h3. Actual Results
Cannot create Issues or view workflows because of NPE and the database table optionconfiguration contains invalid options. 

h3. Workaround
This can be fixed by following the workaround in [NullPointerException when creating issue, editing issue, move issue, accessing the Screen tab from the Project|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/NullPointerException+when+creating+issue,+editing+issue,+move+issue,+accessing+the+Screen+tab+from+the+Project].
fields.summary: Inconsistent database state for Issue Type Scheme on Update and Remove

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61598].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
* Ordering search results by a multi-line text field produces inconsistent results for issues that have no data for that field. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a multi-line text customfield in a JIRA instance having a few projects and issues.
# Enter data into random issues for this custom field.
# Restrict the custom field to a few projects using the customfield configuration option.
# Re-index the instance.
# Search for issues on the instance and order by your customfield

h3. Expected Results
When you order the results by the customfield in ASC order, issues that have data in that field should be sorted first before those where the field is blank, and vice-versa for DESC order.

h3. Actual Results
Issues with no data for the sorted text field, will always appear at the top regardless of wether you sort by ASC or DESC order.

h3. Workaround
Setting the context of the affected text field to Global.
fields.summary: Ordering search results by a multi-line text field provides inconsistent results on large instances

h3. Summary
The options of custom fields that were disabled are returned via REST request. Affected custom fields include:
* Select List (single choice)
* Select List (multiple choices)
* Select List (cascading)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure a custom field of any of the affected type listed above
# Add multiple options
# Disable one option and verify that it is not shown in the screens
# Run the following REST request 
{code:borderStyle=solid}
GET /rest/api/2/issue/createmeta?expand=projects.issuetypes.fields
{code}
# Monitor the custom field options returned

h3. Expected Results
Only non-disabled entries should be returned in allowedValues

h3. Actual Results
All the custom field options are returned in {{allowedValues}} json array

h3. Notes
Similar request from [Atlassian Answers|https://answers.atlassian.com/]: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/274145/hidden-options-for-custom-fields-via-rest-api

h3.Workaround
No workaround is available as of now
fields.summary: disabled customFieldOption entries returned in allowedValues in GET issue/createmeta Rest Api

  {panel}

h3. Summary
When an anonymous user views a dashboard, such as System Dashboard, and the Dashboard only contains gadgets to which they do not have access, it will display as a white page.

Alternatively, if it contains other gadgets, the non-accessible gadgets appear as whitespace

h3. Environment
* JIRA 1000.73.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit System Dashboard so that it only contains Activity Stream or Issues Assigned to Me, for example.
# Logout, and access dashboard directly as Anonymous user

h3. Expected Results
Dashboard should display some sort of message at least so it doesn't appear to be a GUI issue

h3. Actual Results
Screen appears blank as in attached screenshot

h3.Workaround
If you wish for your anonymous users to access the JIRA dashboard, add a few gadgets they will have access to view.
fields.summary: As anonymous user, dashboard displays as white screen when it contains gadgets that are not visible to anonymous users
Translation of a custom field allows only 255 characters

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61590].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently if JIRA Lucene index is corrupted then index is not consistent with the database and JQL search might not work (and/or Dashboards/filters). For example, if Lucene re-index is failed that will lead to problem with the JQL search

h3. Suggested Solution
If Lucene re-index is failed, notify users that JIRA's index is not reliable and they should contact system administrator.
Run periodic health-check and if it's failed, then notify users that JIRA's index is not reliable.
 
h3. Workaround 
None
fields.summary: As an JIRA user I want to be notified when Lucene index is corrupt

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61589].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
JIRA *Indexing* health-check checks the state of the search index is consistent with the database. If JIRA Re-index failed for non-*issue* objects: comments, entities, etc and Lucene index is not consistent, it doesn't report the problem. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Run re-index
# While re-indexing running, delete some part of Lucene data: rm -rf jira_6.4/caches/indexes/comments/*cfs
# Wait for Index completes (with errors)
# Run *Indexing* health-check,


h3. Expected Results
It should report the problem. 

h3. Actual Results
It doesn't report the problem. JQL search is not consistent and might lead to Dashboard/filters errors. 

h3. Notes
See related https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-61577

h3.Workaround
Go to *Administration* > *System* > *Indexing* and check if you see error like:
bq. JIRA is unable to perform a background re-index at this time because the index files are either missing or corrupted.
fields.summary: JIRA health-check doesn't report Lucene corruption
Multiple assignees in a single issue

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you add a user who's username follows the convention "directory\user" to the watcher list in JIRA, you get the error:
{code}
Communications Breakdown

Close this dialog and press refresh in your browser
{code}

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
# Create a user with username: _directory\user_
# Create a test issue.
# As a user with the manage watcher permission, click on the circle and type in the user's name and press enter or click on the result.

(i) _The attached file provides a more detailed guide for reproducing the issue._

h3. *Expected Result*
JIRA adds user to the watcher list.

h3. *Actual Result*
The user is not added and the error mentioned above would pop up.

(i) I tested this with "/" whereby the username is _directory/user_ and the user could be added.

h3. Workaround
* Rename the user not to have this character.
fields.summary: Users Cannot be Added to Watcher List if username contains "\"
